shawlette if you are new to charts please read the step-by-step tutorial pages 6 and 7 for detailed instructions before beginning if you wish to increase the size of your ashton you may repeat chart 2 as many times as you like for an advanced option you may also work more repeats of the large leaves at the border see page 8 for more information about both options if you are making a worsted weight ashton see page 12 for special instructions how to work the charts quick reference see page 3 for more details each chart represents one half of the shawl and will be worked 2 times in succession to create the complete row the 2-stitch garter borders and the center stitch are not shown on the charts in order to simplify the format to make them easier to view the wrong-side even-numbered row that are purled between the garter borders are not shown on the charts for the same reason right-side row knit 2 border stitches work chart right to left right half of shawl knit center stitch work chart right to left again left half of shawl knit 2 border stitches wrong-side row knit 2 border stitches purl across to last 2 stitches knit 2 border stitches bind off once you have completed right-side row 17 from chart 4 with abbreviations the wrong side facing you bind-off with a us 7 4 5 mm needle or one k knit that is two sizes larger than your working needle using the following kfb knit into
